title: Changing behavior could help Long Islanders better recycle and donate food - WSHU
summary: New York's Food Donation and Food Scraps Recycling law requires certain large generators of waste to donate their excess food and recycle food scraps, but only if they are within 25 miles of an organics recycler.   The state's recently proposed solid waste management plan recommends expanding the law to eliminate the 25-mile requirement and increase the development of smaller generators to donate and recycle food scraps.  A pilot program in Calverton, New York, collects food scraps from homes, farms, and restaurants to be composted into nutrient-rich soil.

title: How can farmers deliver on EU Green Deal environmental commitments? | - Open Access Government
summary: The EU Green Deal is a groundbreaking initiative to transform the way we interact with our environment, and farmers have a unique opportunity to drive meaningful change towards sustainability. To meet the environmental commitments of the EU Green Deal, farmers must implement land-use change strategies, soil management techniques, water conservation practices, agricultural biodiversity protection measures, climate change mitigation approaches, renewable energy production guidelines, and waste reduction protocols.

title: Top 20 Best Metal Ore Mining Companies In India 2023 - Inventiva
summary: The Indian metal ore mining industry has grown significantly in recent years, and several companies have emerged as leaders in the sector. These companies have invested heavily in advanced technologies, equipment, and infrastructure to improve efficiency, productivity, and safety in the mining operations. They have also been able to attract investments from domestic and foreign investors.   The top 20 best metal ore mining companies in India in 2023 have demonstrated a commitment to sustainable mining practices, environmental protection, and social responsibility. These companies have adopted the latest mining technologies and equipment to increase efficiency, productivity, and safety in their operations. They have also implemented measures to reduce the impact of their mining activities on the environment and local communities.  The mining industry in India faces various challenges, including regulatory hurdles, infrastructure constraints, and a shortage of skilled manpower. However, the government has taken various initiatives to address these challenges, including the introduction of new mining policies, reforms in the regulatory framework, and investments in infrastructure development.
